0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: Allergic conjunctivitis: 1 drop of 0.05% solution in each EYE twice daily throughout period of allergen exposure, even when symptoms are absent

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• safety and efficacy not established in pediatric patients under 2 years of age
  • Allergic conjunctivitis: (2 years and older) 1 drop of 0.05% solution in each EYE twice daily throughout period of allergen exposure, even when symptoms are absent

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: specific contraindications have not been determined

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• contact lens-related irritation; use not recommended
  • soft contact lens use; benzalkonium chloride preservative may be absorbed by lenses; remove contact lenses prior to administration and wait 10 minutes before reinserting lenses
  • report suspected adverse events to the US Food and Drug Administration at 1-800-433-8871 or www.fda.gov/medwatch

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Epinastine: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Dermatologic:Erythema, Pruritus
  • Neurologic:Headache
  • Ophthalmic:Burning sensation in eye, Follicular conjunctivitis, acute
  • Respiratory:Common cold, Increasing frequency of cough, Pharyngitis, Rhinitis, Sinusitis, Upper respiratory infection

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Epinastine hydrochloride is an antihistamine and an inhibitor of histamine release from the mast cell. It is selective for the histamine H(1)-receptor and has affinity for histamine H(2)-, gamma(1)-, gamma(2)-, and 5-HT(2) receptors

sub.title: Absorption
sub.mono: Oral: time to peak concentration, about 2 h

sub.title: Excretion
sub.mono:
• Fecal: (IV), 30% as unchanged
  • Renal: (IV), 55% unchanged, mainly via active tubular secretion

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• General Information
    for topical ophthalmic use only; not for injection or oral use
  • Ophthalmic
    remove contact lenses prior to instillation; may reinsert 10 minutes following epinastine administration

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono: reduction in ocular itching and irritation

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Advise patients to not wear contact lens if eye is red.
  • This drug may cause headache, burning sensation in eye, follicular conjunctivitis, or signs/symptoms of a common cold.
  • Instruct patient on proper instillation technique.
  • Advise patient to remove contact lenses prior to instilling drug. Lenses may be reinserted 10 min following instillation.
